application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Demolition of existing garage and replacement with one bedroom self-contained two-storey house with associated cycle and bin stores.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Drawing 01, Drawing 02, Drawing 05, Unnumbered Location Plan, Design and Access Statement: Received 28/05/2020. Drawing 03 Rev A: Received 05/10/2020. Drawing 04 Rev A, Drawing 06 Rev A, Drawing 07 Rev A: Received 30/11/2020. Energy Assessment Dated 15th December 2020: Received 16/12/2020) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No above ground works shall take place until samples and product specifications of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the new houses hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Bay studies of the windows on the front elevation shall also be submitted, at a scale of 1:20. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained as such permanently thereafter.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8 am to 6 pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 am to 1 pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.  
No materials or other construction deliveries or collections shall take place at the site outside of these hours.  
Any vehicles that are used on site as part of the construction shall have their wheels cleaned of all mud before they leave the site and the resulting debris and run-off shall not be discharged on to the adjoining footway or carriageway.  
The developer shall monitor the condition of the adjoining highway before and after each delivery and/or collection and the carriageway shall be cleaned immediately if any vehicle involved in these activities sheds mud on to the public highway or pavement, removing all such debris to a collection point within the development site.  
No work shall start on site before details have been submitted to the local planning authority to show the condition of the carriageway and footway within 20 metres of the site on both sides of the road and measures have been put in place to protect the adjoining carriageway and footway from damage at all times.  These shall be retained for the duration of the construction and landscaping phases of the development.  
No site lighting shall be used that sheds light beyond the boundaries of the site, and measures shall be put in place to suppress dust generation during dry weather.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), or any order revoking or re-enacting that order, no alteration, enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the new dwelling shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - a)	Works shall be carried out in accordance with the Energy Statement hereby approved. Prior to first occupation of the new dwelling, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, and approved in writing, to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Statement and any subsequent approved revisions. 
b)	Prior to occupation of the new houses suitable devices for the monitoring of the solar photovoltaic panels shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 7 - Prior to occupation of the hereby approved development, evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers' literature) demonstrating that the development of that phase has been constructed to achieve an internal water consumption by the development not exceeding 105 litres/person/day in line with The Water Efficiency Calculator for new dwellings issued by the Ministry for Housing, Communities and Local Government, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - Prior to occupation, evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate the following:
-At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
-At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
-No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the development, full details (including manufacturer's specifications and means of enclosure) of the cycle parking provision for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall conform to current guidance such as the West London Cycle Parking Guidance in design and layout, and be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 10 - Prior to the occupation of development, details of the arrangements for the storing of waste and recycled materials, including plans and elevations of the means of enclosure shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, these arrangements shall be implemented in accordance with the agreed details and retained as such permanently thereafter.

Condition : 11 - Prior to occupation of the new dwellings, full details and specifications of hard and soft landscaping for the development, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Details shall include planting (including name of species and amount), boundary treatments, hard surfacing and functional services including drainage/manholes/external lighting).

Condition : 12 - Prior to occupation of the new dwellings, the applicant shall have entered into a formal agreement with the Council to provide a payment of ?1,421 towards its Carbon Offset Fund, as outlined in the hereby approved Energy Statement.
